meanings.definition: In a cursed or damned manner
meanings.sent1: The witch cackled accursedly as she cast her spell.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure moved accursedly through the haunted house.
meanings.sent3: The cat accursedly knocked over the vase, pretending it was an accident.
meanings.sent4: The storm raged accursedly, unleashing its fury upon the town.
meanings.sent5: The old book whispered accursedly, warning of the dark magic within.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize a negative quality or action
meanings.sent1: The accursedly difficult puzzle frustrated the young boy.
meanings.sent2: She received an accursedly low grade on her test despite studying hard.
meanings.sent3: The accursedly loud music from the party next door kept him awake all night.
meanings.sent4: The accursedly long line at the grocery store made her late for work.
meanings.sent5: The accursedly rainy weather ruined their plans for a picnic in the park.
